recipes.title: Vegetable Pasta Primavera
recipes.description: A light and healthy pasta dish loaded with fresh vegetables and herbs. This colorful meal is easy to prepare and full of seasonal flavors.

instructions.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook according to package instructions until al dente.
While pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté for 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add zucchini and bell pepper to the skillet, cook for 5 minutes until vegetables begin to soften.
Add cherry tomatoes and cook for another 2 minutes.
Drain pasta, reserving 1/4 cup of pasta water.
Add pasta to the skillet with vegetables. Add reserved pasta water, salt, and pepper. Toss to combine.
Remove from heat and stir in fresh basil and Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Mixed Berry Breakfast Smoothie
recipes.description: A refreshing and nutritious breakfast smoothie packed with antioxidants from mixed berries and protein from Greek yogurt.

instructions.text: Place all ingredients in a blender: frozen berries, banana, Greek yogurt, milk, honey, and chia seeds.
Blend on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute.
If the smoothie is too thick, add a little more milk and blend again until desired consistency is reached.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately. You can top with additional berries or a sprinkle of chia seeds if desired.

recipes.title: Avocado Toast with Poached Egg
recipes.description: A simple yet delicious breakfast featuring creamy avocado on whole grain toast topped with a perfectly poached egg.

instructions.text: Fill a medium saucepan with water and add vinegar. Bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat.
Toast the bread until golden and crisp.
Cut the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop the flesh into a bowl. Add lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Mash with a fork until spreadable but still slightly chunky.
Crack one egg into a small bowl. Create a gentle whirlpool in the simmering water and carefully slide the egg in. Repeat with the second egg. Poach for 3-4 minutes for a runny yolk.
Spread mashed avocado on the toast slices.
Using a slotted spoon, remove the poached eggs and place on top of the avocado toast. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Hearty Lentil Soup
recipes.description: A warming and nutritious soup packed with lentils, vegetables, and aromatic herbs. Perfect for cold days.

ingredients.name: dried green or brown lentils, rinsed

instructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, and celery. Cook for about 5 minutes until vegetables begin to soften.
Add garlic and cumin. Cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add lentils, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, and bay leaf. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 25-30 minutes until lentils are tender.
Remove bay leaf. Add spinach and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until wilted.
Stir in lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Serve hot, optionally topped with a dollop of yogurt or chopped fresh herbs.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
recipes.description: A protein-rich salad with quinoa, fresh vegetables, and Mediterranean flavors. Great for meal prep and healthy lunches.

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan, bring vegetable broth to a boil. Add quinoa, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes until liquid is absorbed.
Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and transfer to a large bowl to cool.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
Add cucumber, cherry tomatoes, bell pepper, red onion, olives, and parsley to the cooled quinoa.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine. Gently fold in the feta cheese.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld. Can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

recipes.title: Simple Chicken Curry
recipes.description: A flavorful and aromatic chicken curry that's easy to make at home. Serve with rice or naan bread for a satisfying dinner.

ingredients.name: boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into pieces

instructions.text: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onions and cook until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add curry powder, turmeric, cumin, and cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
Add chicken pieces and cook until they begin to brown on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
Pour in crushed tomatoes, stir well, and let simmer for 5 minutes.
Add coconut milk and salt. Bring to a gentle simmer and cook uncovered for 15-20 minutes until chicken is cooked through and sauce has thickened slightly.
Stir in garam masala and let cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.

recipes.title: Lemon Herb Baked Salmon
recipes.description: Tender, flaky salmon fillets baked with fresh herbs, lemon, and garlic. A quick and healthy dinner option rich in omega-3 fatty acids.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place salmon fillets on the prepared baking sheet, skin side down.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Brush the mixture over the salmon fillets. Sprinkle with fresh dill and parsley.
Arrange lemon slices on top of and around the salmon fillets.
Bake for 15-18 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Garnish with additional fresh herbs and serve immediately with your choice of side dishes.

recipes.title: Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.description: Classic chocolate chip cookies with a soft center and crispy edges. The perfect balance of sweet and chocolatey goodness.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract until creamy, about 2 minutes.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Gradually beat in flour mixture until just combined. Do not overmix.
Stir in chocolate chips by hand.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
Bake for 9-11 minutes or until golden brown around the edges but still soft in the center.
Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

recipes.title: Easy Apple Crisp
recipes.description: A warm and comforting dessert featuring tender spiced apples topped with a crispy oat and brown sugar topping. Perfect with vanilla ice cream.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Butter a 9x9 inch baking dish.
In a large bowl, toss apple slices with granulated sugar, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, and lemon juice. Spread evenly in the prepared baking dish.
In a medium bowl, mix flour, oats, brown sugar, remaining cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
Cut in butter using a pastry blender or your fingers until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Sprinkle topping evenly over the apple mixture.
Bake for 35-40 minutes or until topping is golden brown and filling is bubbly.
Allow to cool slightly before serving. Delicious when served warm with vanilla ice cream.

recipes.title: Classic Greek Salad
recipes.description: A refreshing traditional Greek salad with crisp vegetables, tangy feta cheese, and Kalamata olives dressed in olive oil and oregano.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine cucumber, tomatoes, bell pepper, and red onion.
Add the olives and gently toss to combine.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently to coat.
Place the feta cheese on top of the salad, either as a large piece or crumbled, according to preference.
Sprinkle with additional oregano if desired and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
recipes.description: A rich and creamy Italian risotto with sautéed mushrooms, white wine, and Parmesan cheese. The perfect comfort food for any night of the week.

instructions.text: In a large pan, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add mushrooms and thyme, sauté until mushrooms are golden and their liquid has evaporated, about 5-7 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, heat remaining olive oil and half the butter. Add onion and cook until soft and translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for another minute.
Add arborio rice and stir to coat with oil and butter. Toast the rice for 1-2 minutes until slightly translucent at the edges.
Pour in the white wine and stir until completely absorbed.
Add warm broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding more. This will take about 18-20 minutes.
When rice is creamy but still has a slight bite (al dente), stir in the sautéed mushrooms, remaining butter, and Parmesan cheese.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and let rest for 2 minutes before serving.
Serve hot, garnished with additional Parmesan cheese and fresh thyme if desired.

recipes.title: Moist Banana Bread
recipes.description: A delicious way to use ripe bananas, this banana bread is moist, tender, and full of banana flavor. Perfect for breakfast or as a snack with coffee.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, mix melted butter and brown sugar until well combined.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition, then stir in vanilla extract.
Stir in mashed bananas until well combined.
Fold in flour mixture just until combined. Do not overmix.
If using, fold in chopped walnuts.
Pour batter into prepared loaf pan and smooth the top.
Bake for 55-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely before slicing.

recipes.title: Quick Vegetable Stir Fry
recipes.description: A colorful and nutritious stir fry loaded with fresh vegetables in a savory sauce. Ready in minutes and perfect for busy weeknights.

instructions.text: Prepare sauce by mixing water, soy sauce, sesame oil, cornstarch, and honey in a small bowl. Set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or frying pan over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add carrots and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add broccoli, bell peppers, and mushrooms. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until vegetables begin to soften but are still crisp.
Add snap peas and stir-fry for another minute.
Pour the sauce over the vegetables and toss to coat. Cook for 1-2 minutes until sauce thickens.
Add red pepper flakes if using.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions before serving.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.

recipes.title: Overnight Chia Seed Pudding
recipes.description: A nutritious make-ahead breakfast pudding made with chia seeds, milk, and your favorite toppings. High in fiber and omega-3 fatty acids.

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together chia seeds, milk, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and salt.
Let the mixture sit for 5 minutes, then whisk again to break up any clumps.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. The pudding will thicken as it sets.
Before serving, stir the pudding. If it's too thick, add a little more milk to reach desired consistency.
Serve in bowls or jars topped with fresh berries, sliced banana, and chopped nuts.

recipes.title: Black Bean Veggie Burgers
recipes.description: Hearty and flavorful vegetarian burgers made with black beans, vegetables, and spices. A healthy alternative to traditional meat burgers.

ingredients.name: flax egg (1 tbsp ground flaxseed + 3 tbsp water)
lettuce, tomato, and other toppings as desired

instructions.text: Prepare flax egg by mixing ground flaxseed with water. Let sit for 5 minutes to thicken.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, mash black beans with a fork or potato masher, leaving some beans partially intact for texture.
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add onion and bell pepper, cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook for another minute.
Add vegetable mixture to the mashed beans along with flax egg, breadcrumbs, and all spices. Mix well to combine.
Divide mixture into 4 equal portions and form into patties about 3/4 inch thick.
Heat remaining olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook patties for 4-5 minutes on each side until browned and crisp on the outside.
Transfer patties to the prepared baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes to heat through.
Serve on hamburger buns with your favorite toppings and condiments.

recipes.title: Simple Roasted Vegetables
recipes.description: A colorful medley of oven-roasted vegetables with herbs and olive oil. Perfect as a side dish or add to salads, bowls, and pasta.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C) and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine sweet potato, bell peppers, zucchini, red onion, broccoli, and cherry tomatoes.
Add minced garlic, olive oil, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper. Toss to coat all vegetables evenly.
Spread vegetables in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Don't overcrowd the pan (use two sheets if necessary).
Roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring halfway through, until vegetables are tender and lightly browned around the edges.
If using, drizzle with balsamic vinegar immediately after removing from the oven.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

recipes.title: Homemade Hummus
recipes.description: Smooth and creamy chickpea dip with tahini, lemon, and garlic. Perfect for snacking with vegetables or pita bread, or as a sandwich spread.

instructions.text: In a food processor, combine chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, olive oil, cumin, and salt.
Process until smooth, about 1-2 minutes, scraping down the sides as needed.
With the processor running, slowly add water until you reach your desired consistency.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed, adding more salt, lemon juice, or cumin if desired.
Transfer to a serving bowl, drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle with paprika.
Serve with pita bread, vegetables, or use as a spread for sandwiches and wraps.

recipes.title: Oatmeal Raisin Cookies
recipes.description: Soft and chewy oatmeal cookies packed with plump raisins and warm spices. These classic cookies make a perfect afternoon treat with a glass of milk.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together oats, flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat butter and both sugars until creamy, about 2 minutes.
Add egg and vanilla extract to the butter mixture and beat until well combined.
Gradually stir the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until just combined.
Fold in raisins and nuts (if using).
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing about 2 inches apart.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until cookies are golden around the edges but still soft in the center.
Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

recipes.title: Creamy Tomato Basil Soup
recipes.description: A comforting homemade tomato soup with fresh basil and a touch of cream. Perfect paired with a grilled cheese sandwich for a classic meal.

instructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add carrots and cook for 5 minutes until beginning to soften.
Add canned tomatoes with their juice, breaking them up with a spoon. Stir in tomato paste, vegetable broth, oregano, sugar, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes until carrots are very soft.
Add most of the basil, reserving some for garnish.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth (or transfer to a blender in batches).
Return to low heat and stir in the heavy cream. Adjust seasonings to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with remaining fresh basil and a drizzle of cream if desired.

recipes.title: Homemade Crunchy Granola
recipes.description: A nutritious and customizable breakfast granola with oats, nuts, and dried fruits. Perfect with yogurt or milk for a wholesome start to your day.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C) and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine oats, nuts, seeds, coconut, cinnamon, and salt.
In a small bowl, whisk together melted coconut oil, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients and stir until everything is well coated.
Spread the mixture evenly on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes, until golden brown.
Remove from oven and let cool completely on the baking sheet. The granola will crisp up as it cools.
Once cooled, add dried fruits and mix well.
Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 weeks.
